hanzi-su-wiki:
脑

Значения

Мозг; голова; ум

Мнемоника

Мозг — часть тела ⺼, в котором порой появляютя злодейские 凶 мысли. Но их необходимо "накрывать" 亠.

Варианты

胸, 腦, 脳

nǎo
brain; mind; head; essence
мозг; разум; голова; сущность
rtega_mnemonic:
腦腦RS
脑脑		脳匘brain
  • the brain 𡿺 of a man ⺼
  • ⓢ a man ⺼ who covers 亠 bad 凶 ideas and improves them uses his brain
  • modf. 腦 → 脳
  • ⓢ the meat 月 that controls 乂 us from a box 凵 on the head 亠
purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 腦)
Pictophonetic: 齐 indicates the sound; ⺼ (flesh) conveys the meaning.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The farmer's almanac is like a brain that allows farmers to think of weather as a steady stream of changes, like the moon's behavior, instead of a violent ocean of surprises.

脑字的基本解释

脑
（腦）
nǎo
高等动物神经系统的主要部分，在颅腔里，主管感觉和运动。人脑又是思想记忆等心理活动的器官：脑髓。脑子（ａ．脑；ｂ．指思考、记忆等能力）。脑筋。脑海。脑际。脑壳。脑颅。脑神经。脑下垂体。脑积水。脑溢血。电脑。
头：脑袋。脑壳。头昏脑胀。脑满肠肥。
形状或颜色像脑的东西：豆腐脑儿。
指从物体中提炼出的精华部分：樟脑。薄荷脑。

脑字的汉语字典释义

[①]［nǎo］
［《廣韻》奴晧切，上晧，泥。］
“脑1”的繁体字。
(1)高等动物主管全身运动和感觉的器官，是神经系统的主要部分。人脑还主管思维、记忆等活动。
(2)称能模拟或代替人脑进行某种活动的事物。
(3)头颅。
(4)谓击破头颅，脑浆溢出。引申指打击。
(5)物体的顶端、中心或边缘部分。
(6)指白色如脑状或脑髓之物。

脑字的英文翻译

◎ 脑
brain, encephalon, harns, pericranium

脑字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　腦； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页982第17
【廣韻】奴皓切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】乃老切，?音惱。【說文】本作匘。頭髓也。　又【廣韻】那到切【集韻】乃到切，?音?。【廣韻】優皮也。【集韻】瀀澤也。　又【韻會】或作?。【周禮·冬官考工記·弓人】角之本蹙於?。　【廣韻】同堖。或从?。【集韻】或作??。

brain
Basic explanation of words
brain
(brain)
nǎo
The main part of the nervous system of higher animals, in the cranial cavity, is responsible for sensation and movement. The human brain is also an organ for mental activities such as thought and memory: the brain marrow. Brain (a. Brain; b. Refers to the ability of thinking, memory, etc.). Brains. Mind. Brain. skull. Brain. Cranial nerves. pituitary gland. hydrocephalus. Cerebral hemorrhage. computer.
Head: head. skull. Dizziness. The brain is full of intestinal fat.
Something that looks like a brain in shape or color: tofu brain.
Refers to the essence extracted from the object: camphor. Menthol.
brain
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［nǎo］
["Guangyun" Slave cutting, upper sea, mud. ]
Traditional characters for "脑1".
(1) Higher animals are in charge of body movement and sensory organs, and are the main part of the nervous system. The human brain is also in charge of thinking, memory and other activities.
(2) It refers to things that can simulate or replace the human brain to perform certain activities.
(3) Head.
(4) It is said that when the head is broken, the brain plasma overflows. The extension refers to the blow.
(5) The top, center or edge part of the object.
(6) Refers to white things like brains or brains.
brain

brain, encephalon, harns, pericranium

羊脑 бараньи мозги
